name: "Ocarina of Time" - The Sages Quiz | Ocarina of Time | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which sage doesn't teach you a song?
questions.explanation:
Darunia.

	These sages are Impa, Saria, and Zelda.  Impa teaches Link Zelda's Lullaby before escorting him out of Hyrule Castle, Saria teaches Saria's Song when Link meets her outside the Forest Temple in Sacred Forest Meadow, and Zelda teaches Link all of  the warping songs as well as the Song of Time.

questions.text: Which sage is not found inside his/her temple?
questions.explanation:
Impa.

	Darunia is found upon entering the Fire Temple; Link can find him outside the boss room preparing to battle Volvagia.  Nabooru is in the Spirit Temple in the present as well as the future because Link can find her in the entrance searching for the gauntlets when he's a child, and he has to battle her in the future before fighting Twinrova.  Ruto attempts to save the Zoras when Link finds her on the bottom floor of the Water Temple.

questions.text: What item does Nabooru expect you to get for her when you first meet her?
questions.explanation:
Silver Gauntlets & The Silver Gauntlets.

	When Link first meets Nabooru, she's in the entrance of the Spirit Temple looking for the gauntlets.  Since Link is a child, she asks him to fit into a small hole and acquire the gauntlets from the west side of the temple.  After obtaining them from a platform outside the temple, Nabooru is captured by Koume and Kotake, the bosses of the temple.

questions.text: How many of the sages give Link Spiritual Stones?
questions.explanation:
Two.

	Darunia gives Link the Goron Ruby, and Ruto gives Link the Zora Sapphire.  The first Spiritual Stone, the Kokiri Emerald, is given to Link by the Great Deku Tree before he succumbs to Ganon's curse.

questions.text: Which sage must be fought during the game?
questions.explanation:
Nabooru.

	After being taken by Koume and Kotake, Nabooru was brainwashed for seven years until she was used against Link.  Before beating Twinrova, Link must fight an Iron Knuckle.  Inside the suit, Nabooru is found, and once she is freed, she's taken again until Link defeats Twinrova.

questions.text: Which sage is not seen during the end credits?
questions.explanation:
Rauru.

	All of the sages (excluding Zelda and Rauru) travel to the top of Death Mountain while everyone is celebrating at Lon Lon Ranch during the end credits, and Zelda is found at the end of the credits.  Rauru is the first sage to give Link a medallion during the game.

questions.text: What do the sages not use their powers to do?
questions.correct: Make the final blow on Ganon
options: Open the door to the Sacred Realm
Bring down the force-field in Ganon's Castle
Make a bridge to Ganon's Castle
questions.explanation:
Make the final blow on Ganon.

	After receiving medallions from all of the sages, their powers are given to Link to use in the battle against Ganon.  The only sage not giving Link a medallion is Zelda, but she gives the Light Arrows instead.

questions.text: Who is the only Sage not met for the first time while Link is a child?
questions.explanation:
Rauru.

	Link first meets Rauru after stumbling upon the Sacred Realm and growing seven years.  After waking, Rauru informs Link that he's been asleep for seven years in order to grow up as the Hero of Time.  Rauru then adds his power to Link's and gives him the Light Medallion.

questions.text: In what room in the Temple of Light does Link receive the Sage Medallions?
options: The Chamber of the Sacred Realm
questions.explanation:
The Chamber of Sages.

	After defeating the boss of each temple, Link is transported to the Temple of Light where he is greeted by one of the sages on their Sage's Seals.  After this, Link receives one of the Sage's Medallions depending on which temple he has just defeated.

questions.text: How many Sage Medallions does Link receive by the end of the game?
questions.explanation:
Six.

	Link receives one medallion from Saria, Darunia, Ruto, Impa, and Nabooru by defeating the bosses in each of their temples.  An additional medallion is obtained after Link pulls the Master Sword out of the Pedestal of Time, this time from Rauru.
